question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable for demonstration purposes. I need to complete an e-commerce website design assignment: How can I create a localized version of JD.com? I don't need JD's data, just the website framework that looks exactly the same.

checklist.title: Is the core e-commerce homepage structure fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements the key structural components of JD.com's homepage, including the primary navigation bar, promotional banner carousel, product grid display, and category sidebar. Score 0 if the basic structure is missing, 5 if only partial components are implemented, and 10 if the complete JD.com layout structure is replicated with proper responsive design principles.

checklist.title: Is the product listing and category navigation system properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code includes JD's multi-level category navigation system, product listing pages with filtering options, and sorting mechanisms. Check if the implementation includes breadcrumb navigation, proper grid/list view options, and pagination functionality. Deduct 5 points if the category system is oversimplified, 3 points if filtering options are missing, and 2 points if pagination is not implemented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the product detail page complete with all necessary components?
checklist.description: Check whether the product detail page includes all critical components: image gallery with zoom functionality, product description tabs, specifications table, price display with discount calculations, buying options (quantity, variants), and the 'add to cart' functionality. Deduct 3 points for each missing major component. Award full 10 points only if the layout perfectly mirrors JD's product detail page structure.

checklist.title: Is the shopping cart and checkout process flow correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Assess whether the implementation includes JD's shopping cart preview, full cart page, address selection, payment method selection, and order confirmation screens. The code should handle cart item management (add, remove, update quantity) and preserve cart data across sessions. Deduct 5 points if the cart functionality is basic without session persistence, and 5 points if the checkout flow is incomplete. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as API request failures, invalid inputs, empty search results, out-of-stock products, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or fallback mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Real-time price comparison 2. Personalized recommendation engine 3. Voice search capability 4. AR product visualization). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple cart management systems) 2. Function modules unrelated to e-commerce (e.g., a built-in game center not present in JD) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations causing lag). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating UI components, business logic, and data services), component reusability, code organization, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state management is poorly implemented; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet JD.com's design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the design accurately replicates JD.com's: 1) Exact color scheme (including the characteristic red accent color) 2) Proper layout spacing and proportions 3) Typography system and icon set. Deduct 3 points for each visual element that doesn't match JD's style, 5 points for incorrect color palette usage, and 5 points for significant layout differences from the original site. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects match JD.com's interaction patterns: 1) Hover effects on navigation menus 2) Smooth transitions between pages 3) Lazy loading of product images 4) Responsive feedback on buttons and interactive elements. Deduct 5 points for each key interaction pattern that differs from JD's implementation, 3 points for sluggish animations, and 5 points for missing hover states and visual feedback. The full score is 10 points.
